intro: Ampelopsis dissecta, commonly known as the dissected honeysuckle, is a deciduous climbing vine native to eastern North America. It features compound leaves with finely dissected lobes, giving it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters, typically in shades of white or yellow, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in partial to full sun and is often found in moist, wooded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
